title: Dynamics of Rotational Motion: Rotational Inertia
body: The triceps muscle in the back of the upper arm extends the forearm. This muscle in a professional boxer exerts a force of $$2.00$$ * $${10}^3$$ N with an effective perpendicular lever arm of $$3.00$$ cm, producing an angular acceleration of the forearm of $$120$$ $$\frac{rad}{s^2}$$.
